name: hdf
description:
HDF4 (also known as HDF) is a library and multi-object file format for
storing and managing data between machines.

dependencies.name: gnuconfig
dependencies.description:
The GNU config.guess and config.sub scripts versioned by timestamp.
This package can be used as a build dependency for autotools packages
that ship a tarball with outdated config.guess and config.sub files.

dependencies.name: zlib
dependencies.description:
A free, general-purpose, legally unencumbered lossless data-compression
library.

dependencies.name: jpeg
dependencies.description:
libjpeg is a widely used free library with functions for handling the
JPEG image data format. It implements a JPEG codec (encoding and
decoding) alongside various utilities for handling JPEG data.

dependencies.name: szip
dependencies.description:
Libaec provides fast lossless compression of 1 up to 32 bit wide signed
or unsigned integers (samples). It implements Golomb-Rice compression
method under the BSD license and includes a free drop-in replacement for
the SZIP library.

dependencies.name: rpc
dependencies.description: Libtirpc is a port of Suns Transport-Independent RPC library to Linux.

dependencies.name: bison
dependencies.description:
Bison is a general-purpose parser generator that converts an annotated
context-free grammar into a deterministic LR or generalized LR (GLR)
parser employing LALR(1) parser tables.

dependencies.name: flex
dependencies.description: Flex is a tool for generating scanners.

dependencies.name: java
dependencies.description:
The Java Development Kit (JDK) released by Oracle Corporation in the
form of a binary product aimed at Java developers. Includes a complete
JRE plus tools for developing, debugging, and monitoring Java
applications.

dependent_to.name: gdal
dependent_to.description:
GDAL (Geospatial Data Abstraction Library) is a translator library for
raster and vector geospatial data formats that is released under an
X/MIT style Open Source license by the Open Source Geospatial
Foundation. As a library, it presents a single raster abstract data
model and vector abstract data model to the calling application for all
supported formats. It also comes with a variety of useful command line
utilities for data translation and processing.

dependent_to.name: hdfview
dependent_to.description:
HDFView is a visual tool written in Java for browsing and editing HDF
(HDF5 and HDF4) files.

dependent_to.name: hdf-eos2
dependent_to.description:
HDF-EOS (Hierarchical Data Format - Earth Observing System) is a self-
describing file format based upon HDF for standard data products that
are derived from EOS missions. HDF-EOS2 is based upon HDF4.

dependent_to.name: h5utils
dependent_to.description:
h5utils is a set of utilities for visualization and conversion of
scientific data in the free, portable HDF5 format.

dependent_to.name: gdl
dependent_to.description:
A free and open-source IDL/PV-WAVE compiler. GNU Data Language (GDL) is
a free/libre/open source incremental compiler compatible with IDL and to
some extent with PV-WAVE.

dependent_to.name: ncl
dependent_to.description:
NCL is an interpreted language designed specifically for scientific data
analysis and visualization. Supports NetCDF 3/4, GRIB 1/2, HDF 4/5, HDF-
EOD 2/5, shapefile, ASCII, binary. Numerous analysis functions are
built-in.

dependent_to.name: netcdf-c
dependent_to.description:
NetCDF (network Common Data Form) is a set of software libraries and
machine-independent data formats that support the creation, access, and
sharing of array-oriented scientific data. This is the C distribution.
